title: UC Merced PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: UC Merced PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request's fulfillment.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests from January 1, 2024 to the date of this request's fulfillment.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any open zoning, building, or fire code violations currently on record; the certificates of occupancy; and any special zoning approvals (planned development approvals, special/conditional permits, variances, or etc.) for Green Tree Apartments, 749 Green Tree Circle, Chesapeake, VA 23320.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Lindsey McQuiddy.

title: Vidalia IT and Social Media RFP, Bid, and Contract

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vidalia IT and Social Media RFP, Bid, and Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The RFP that the City of Vidalia published which resulted in the recent contract it entered into with Parlor Marketing for web and social media services.
The location(s) where this RFP was published, including publication dates.
The bid that Parlor Marketing submitted in response.
The contract that the City entered into with Parlor Marketing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Andrew Laurel

title: Lake Geneva Wisconsin Invoice for appraisal

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Lake Geneva Wisconsin Invoice for appraisal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please send a copy of the invoice for the appraisal provided to the Lake Geneva city council members on July 14,2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

Hello,

The City is in receipt of your open records request. Please be aware of the following if applicable:
•	The charge for copies of records is 25 cents per side of page.
•	The charge for any other media is at the actual cost.
•	Pursuant to 19.35(3)(f), Wis. Stats., if the amount to be imposed is more than $5.00, the authority may require prepayment. 
•	Pursuant to Section 19.35(3)(c), Wis. Stats., if the cost to locate the record will cost more than $50.00, the authority may require payment of the location costs. 
•	If a record request response is mailed, the authority may charge the actual postage amount, to be paid before mailing.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in the format requested. Grebner v. Schiebel, 2001 WI App 17, 240 Wis.2d 551.
•	The City is not obligated to provide records in a time frame established by the requester. Reasonableness of the response time is determined by the volume of records requested, the ability to locate the records, review of records for possible redaction, and other work assignments. Journal Times v. City of Racine Bd. of Police & Fire Comm’rs, 2015 WI 56, 362 Wis.2d 577; WIREdata Inc. v. Village of Sussex, 2008 WI 69, 310 Wis.2d 397.
We are in the process of evaluating your request and will provide further information as it becomes available. 

Thank you,

Vanessa Jahns
 
Deputy City Clerk

title: Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI) (Bureau of Land Management)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Your Enterprise Data Inventory (EDI), as described in federal guidance https://resources.data.gov/assets/documents/CDOC_Data_Inventory_Report_Final.pdf?trk=public_post_comment-text, in a machine-readable database or spreadsheet format such as Excel, CSV, Access or SQL. 

I also request all documentation that describes the layout of the database’s tables and fields, and that provides the definitions of any field names, codes, and abbreviations used in the database. This information may be gathered together in a single document like a data dictionary, entity layout, or user's guide. If that is the case, I request access to and copy of said document.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Records retention schedule (Bureau of Prisons)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all materials, indices, directives, manuals, and other guiding documentation regarding records generated and retained, including but not limited to: 

• Record retention schedules
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

title: Records retention schedule (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all materials, indices, directives, manuals, and other guiding documentation regarding records generated and retained, including but not limited to: 

• Record retention schedules
• Any other data structures used for the management of records: digital, paper, and otherwise

I request that you release records for this request on a rolling basis as they become available and in electronic form. If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address. If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Dillon Bergin

- All guides, memos or briefings on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

- All polices on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records. 

-  All employee training materials on storing and handling electronic records, including but not limited to text messages, as federal records.

title: Reocords Request: Suspected Falsified Documents to the EPA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Reocords Request: Suspected Falsified Documents to the EPA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-A log of complaints, filed to the Environmental Protection Agency between January 1st, 2025 and the date of response to this request, concerning the suspected tampering, misrepresentation, or otherwise altering of documents, permits, certifications, or any other records required by environmental statutes and/or regulations.

I'm a journalist with the nonprofit newsroom Sentient. Any responsive documents will be used in reporting relating to public health, safety, and environmental concerns in the public interest.

In the case that the response to this is voluminous, I would appreciate being provided records in installments to expedite the process.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

title: Tyler Robinson Arrest 2 (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and a copy of body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by officers of the Utah Valley University Police Department related specifically to the arrest of Tyler Robinson on the evening of September 11, 2025.

Primary subject of request: Arrest of Tyler Robinson (suspect connected to the Charlie Kirk homicide investigation)

Relevant prior event context: Homicide of Charlie Kirk on September 10, 2025 (for situational context only)

Date of records requested: September 11, 2025

Approximate time frame: Beginning around 6:00 p.m. on Sept. 11, 2025, and continuing for several hours thereafter (evening hours)

Location: Within the jurisdiction of the Utah Valley University Police Department; expected in/around Orem, Utah (Utah County). If the arrest occurred at a different precise location within UVU PD jurisdiction, please include all responsive BWC from that location.

Type of incident: Arrest (law enforcement action)

Records requested:

All BWC footage capturing the detention, arrest, transport, and on-scene interactions with Tyler Robinson on Sept. 11, 2025, within the time window above.

Any BWC footage from responding/assisting UVU PD officers at that scene during the same window (including pre-arrest approach and post-arrest processing on scene).

Case number / officers: Unknown. If available, please include the case number and the names/badge numbers of officers whose cameras recorded the footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Dohanyos

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Susheel Kumar Visa Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Visa records from 01/JAN/1986 to 01/JAN/1989 including:
- Visa applications
- Approvals
- Documents submitted with application.

For 
- Name: SUSHEEL KUMAR
- Naturalized US Citizen.
- US Passport# 583025795
- Alien Num A29759684
- Date of Birth: 03/12/1960
- Place of Birth: HYDERABAD, INDIA

Visa Details
- Visa Issued at US Consulate: MADRAS (currently CHENNAI), INDIA
- Visa Classification: F1
- Visa Number 103132

communications.subject: Here's your recovery link
communications.communication:
Your password recovery link: 
https://pal.foia.state.gov/App/SetPassword.aspx?aun=4waOOj72TP5cPKpz6B+Ea6azEQRC0PcnnyWnc+TzhYg= (https://pal.foia.state.gov/App/SetPassword.aspx?aun=4waOOj72TP5cPKpz6B+Ea6azEQRC0PcnnyWnc+TzhYg=) 

Click the link above to return to U.S. Department of State PAL and create your new password.

communications.subject: Your Login Information for U.S. Department of State Requests
communications.communication:
Dear Saurabh  Agarwal, 

Thank you for creating a profile in the Department of State's database.  The Department created a temporary password and sent it to the email address provided. Please check your email for this temporary password and return to https://pal.foia.state.gov to login. 
Username: 192987-21270660@requests.muckrock.com 

Kindly change the password provided by us.  Should you require further assistance, please contact FOIAStatus@state.gov
Regards, 
Office of Information Access Liaison 
Information Access Programs 
U.S. Department of State

communications.subject: Ref: F-2025-28156
communications.communication:
Dear Saurabh Agarwal: 

This acknowledges you information access request to the U.S. Department of State.  Your request number is F-2025-28156. You will find additional information such as the date your request was received and your request status in your electronic portal page under this case number. 

If you requested expedited processing, a fee waiver, or if unusual circumstances apply, you will receive additional correspondence from us. 
For further assistance or to discuss any aspect of your request, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIA Public Liaison via email to FOIAStatus@state.gov or by telephone at (202) 261-8484. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov)
Regards, 
Office of Information Access Liaison 
Information Access Programs 
U.S. Department of State

communications.subject: Status Update for Request #F-2025-28156 with U.S. Department of State
communications.communication:
Dear Saurabh  Agarwal, 

The status of your FOIA request #F-2025-28156 has been updated to the following status 'Received'. To learn more, you may log into the DoS FOIA Portal via the Application URL at https://pal.foia.state.gov. 
If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Please check your email account (including junk/spam mail) for the Department's response OR allow 7 to 10 business days to receive the Department's response by US Postal Service mail.
Regards, 
U.S. Department of State

title: Records Request: Complaints filed to the Indiana State Board of Animal Health

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Records Request: Complaints filed to the Indiana State Board of Animal Health
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-A copy of all complaints filed to the Indiana State Board of Animal Health, between January 1st, 2025 and the date of response to this request. 

I'm a journalist with the nonprofit newsroom Sentient. Any responsive documents will be used in reporting in the public interest, relating to safety of the U.S. food system and the welfare of farm animals.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

communications.subject: FW: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Records Request: Complaints filed to the Indiana State Board of Animal Health
communications.communication:
Hi, Grey:
Thank you for your email.

Clarification is needed before we can begin searching for records. Indiana’s public records law (APRA) requires a request for public records to be made with “reasonable particularity,” which is necessary for an agency to locate and disclose records responsive to a request accurately and efficiently. See Ind. Code § 5-14-3-3(a). Indiana’s Public Access Counselor has written many advisory opinions on what “reasonable particularity” means; for example, the Public Access Counselor advises that requests for emails include a specifically named sender and recipient, a date range of less than six months, and search terms. See Advisory Opinion of the Public Access Counselor 16-FC-128.

To enable us to conduct a search, please narrow your request as outlined below.

To be clear, the Indiana State Board of Animal Health is not denying your request, but is instead asking that you amend your request to satisfy the legal requirements of APRA. After receipt of such an amended request, responsive records will be identified and gathered. It may be that some records will be produced subject to redaction and other documents may be withheld as permitted by applicable law. Pursuant to Indiana Code § 5-14-3-3, disclosable records will be provided in a reasonable period of time.



Denise Derrer Spears
Public Information Director
Indiana State Board of Animal Health   www.in.gov/boah<http://www.in.gov/boah>
Indiana Board of Veterinary Medicine   www.in.gov/VetBoard<http://www.in.gov/VetBoard>
Office:  317-544-2414
Mobile:  317-501-7583

*We'd love your feedback. Tell us how we did!<https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=ur-ZIQmkE0-wxBi0WTPYjYJ1__yBveJJqz4cJi1J0mBUOVJKOVpVNzFIRVc4VFY5Ulk4T1dOSVRDNC4u>
